etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Charles Shepard (1804–1886). After German Pseudomalachit

definitions: A mineral resembling malachite that typically occurs as botryoidal masses and fibrous aggregates of dark green translucent crystals and is a secondary mineral found in oxidized zones of copper ore deposits.

notes.text: Pseudomalachite is a phosphate and hydroxide of copper, Cu₅(PO₄)₂(OH)₄. Crystal system: monoclinic.
